title: ICE: borrowck for user-type with inferred higher ranked type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```Rust
struct Ty1;
struct Ty2;

pub trait Trait<T> {}

pub trait WithAssoc1<'a> {
    type Assoc;
}
pub trait WithAssoc2<'a> {
    type Assoc;
}

impl<T, U> Trait<for<'a> fn(<T as WithAssoc1<'a>>::Assoc, <U as WithAssoc2<'a>>::Assoc)> for (T, U)
where
    T: for<'a> WithAssoc1<'a> + for<'a> WithAssoc2<'a, Assoc = i32>,
    U: for<'a> WithAssoc2<'a>,
{
}

impl WithAssoc1<'_> for Ty1 {
    type Assoc = ();
}
impl WithAssoc2<'_> for Ty1 {
    type Assoc = i32;
}
impl WithAssoc1<'_> for Ty2 {
    type Assoc = ();
}
impl WithAssoc2<'_> for Ty2 {
    type Assoc = u32;
}

fn foo<T, U, V>()
where
    T: for<'a> WithAssoc1<'a>,
    U: for<'a> WithAssoc2<'a>,
    (T, U): Trait<V>,
{
}

fn main() {
    foo::<Ty1, Ty2, _>();
}
```
